page.title: 04URBAN DERELICTION-LANDSCAPE
page.content: Great efforts have been made, in the last decade or so, to erase the scars left by the Industrialists of the 18th and 19th Centuries.Much of the countryside was used as an industrial tipping ground, with no thought for the future. Today,much of the derelict land has been reclaimed and is used by farmers as rough grazing for cattle and sheep.The area suprisingly supports a number of small holdings which provide an alternative life style in a marginal farming community.The landscape has blended quite well into the countryside, although there is a marked absence of trees on much of the reclaimed area,which still gives the impression of a rather{sterile}landscape.
